name: The Standoff
paragraphs: You slowly lower yourself to the ground, your hands up in surrender. The guards keep their guns trained on you, their expressions unreadable. There's a tense silence in the hallway as everyone waits to see what will happen next. Then, one of the guards steps forward and asks you who you are and why you're here.

You tell them everything that's happened, about your parents' strange behavior, about the symbols on the wall, and about the voice that spoke to you in the cell. The guards exchange skeptical glances, but they also seem to be weighing the possibility that you might be telling the truth. Finally, after what feels like an eternity, one of them lowers his gun and offers you a hand up. He tells you that they've been investigating the prison for weeks, trying to figure out what's been going on. They need all the help they can get.
